title: Looking for this font used for a school...
author: Neve78

comments.content:
Whole bunch of names. None of which are being sold today I would guess.

CastCraft Software/OPTIOliver-Display  
Art I Need/Gutkha  
Brendel Informatik/Sunflower  
Euro Font/EFN Zawijany  
EnStep Incorporated/IMPOSING Regular  
Future Corporation/Austinatious  
Grunert, Rainer/OliveOil  
Grunert, Rainer/Orient

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317220610im_/http:/typophile.com/files/parl1_3940.jpg)

Good research Dick.  
The original name could be Oriente -- at least this is the name for the font as shown in Jaspert's \_Type Encyclopedia\_ -- for this Victorian flourished script.  
As for who did the original digitization of it, that's a good question.  
Don
Originally, yes, Oriente - by Rainer Laich, c. 1900 for ATF.

WOW Thanks a lot!  
I've found it thanks to the name Grunert, Rainer. I've found it on [www.dafont.com](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317220610/http:/www.dafont.com/ "www.dafont.com"), the name of the font here is "Oliver", authors Christine Mauerkirchner & Rainer Grunert - category Fantasy-retro'.

Thanks again!
